user_intent: Comply with web content accessibility standards
tool_name: Worldwibe Web Consortium (W3C) Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Comply with web content accessibility standards
Tool Name: Worldwibe Web Consortium (W3C) Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
Description: WCAG 2.2 is a set of guidelines designed to make digital content more accessible, usable, and inclusive for people with disabilities by improving navigation, input methods, and overall user experience.
Common User Queries:
I want to make my online services more inclusive
I want to understand what digital inclusion means
How do I design for users with low digital literacy?

user_intent: Select and use accessible web authoring tools
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Select and use accessible web authoring tools
Tool Name: Authoring Tool Accessibility Guidelines (ATAG)
Description: ATAG 2.0 is a set of guidelines that authors (e.g., web developers, designers, writers, etc.) must follow to create web content that conforms to WCAG standards and is itself accessible for people with disabilities to use.
Common User Queries:
I want to find tools to make my website more accessible
How do I test my website for accessibility issues?
How do I choose the right accessibility plugins?

User Intent: Implement advanced accessibility features
Tool Name: Accessible Rich Internet Applications (WAI-ARIA)
Description: The WAI-ARIA 1.2 specification defines a standard ontology of roles, states, and properties that web authors can use to make web applications accessible to users of assistive technologies.
Common User Queries:
I want to make forms accessible to screen readers
I want to improve navigation for users with disability
How do I make my web app accessible with a keyboard

user_intent: Design content for cognitive and learning disabilities
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Design content for cognitive and learning disabilities
Tool Name: Cognitive Accessibility Guidance
Description: This supplemental guidance to the WCAG standard offers recommendations for better addressing the accessibility needs of people with cognitive and learning disabilities.
Common User Queries:
I want to make my content easier to understand
How do I reduce cognitive overload on my website?
I want to design for users with learning difficulties

User Intent: Plan and organise physical meetings
Tool Name: Accessible Meetings Toolkit
Description: Practical guidance on organising accessible and inclusive events and meetings, with tips on issues to consider in the planning, delivery and follow-up stages.
Common User Queries:
I want to plan an accessible and inclusive event
How do I provide accessible seating and navigation?
I want to ensure my event information is accessible to everyone

user_intent: Engage effectively with people with disability
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Engage effectively with people with disability
Tool Name: CBMA Disability Movement Strenghening Framework
Description: This document outlines CBM Australia’s principles and practical approach to strengthening disability movements through rights-based, locally led, and partnership-focused support.
Common User Queries:
I want to communicate respectfully with people with disabilities
I want to involve people with disability in decision-making
How do use inclusive language when talking about disability?

User Intent: Apply gender-inclusive practices
Tool Name: CBMA-The-inclusion-of-women-with-disabilities-in-gender-programming-and-womens-movements
Description: This paper highlights how women with disabilities are often overlooked in mainstream gender programming and women’s rights movements, and calls for stronger inclusion, partnership with OPDs, and intersectional approaches to advance their rights and leadership.
Common User Queries:
How do I make my services more gender inclusive?
I want to avoid gender bias in my content
How do I design policies that support gender equality?

tool_name: CBM Disability and gender Analysis Toolkit
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Conduct gender and disability analysis
Tool Name: CBM Disability and gender Analysis Toolkit
Description: This toolkit provides a structured, participatory process to help organisations assess and strengthen disability and gender equality across their policies, culture, programmes and practices.
Common User Queries:
I want to understand how gender and disability intersect
How do I identify barriers faced by women with disabilities?
I want to apply a gender and disability framework

user_intent: Design and implement inclusive data collection
tool_name: Collecting and using data on disability to inform inclusive development
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Design and implement inclusive data collection
Tool Name: Collecting and using data on disability to inform inclusive development
Description: The document explains why and how to collect disability-disaggregated data — and offers practical guidance and tools — to ensure that development programs are inclusive of people with disabilities at all stages.
Common User Queries: 
How do I design accessible surveys?
I want to collect disability data ethically
How do I disaggregate data by gender and disability?

User Intent: Identify essential assistive products
Tool Name: WHO Priority Assistive Product List
Description: This documented outlines a curated list of assistive technological products aimed towards practitioners wanting to deepen their understanding of these products and serving as a blueprint for Member States to develop their own assistive product list. 
Common User Queries:
How do I support users that rely on screen readers?
I want to understand different types of assistive tools
What assistive tools are available for vision impaired users?

user_intent: Access professional standards and training for assistive technology practitioners
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Access professional standards and training for assistive technology practitioners
Tool Name: ARATA website
Description: ARATA is one the contributing organisations to Standards Australia's development of the ME-067 standard for assistive technologies.
Common User Queries:
I want to provide training on assistive technologies
How do I choose the right assistive tool?
I want to make my website compatible with assistive technology

user_intent: Search, compare, and source specific assistive equipment
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Search, compare, and source specific assistive equipment
Tool Name: Australia's National Equipment Database (NED)
Description: A comprehensive database of nationwide available assistive technologies including models and prices.
Common User Queries:
What assistive technologies are available for people with hearing disability?
What is the price range of mobility assistive tools?
Can you help me to compare prices and models of available screen readers?

tool_name: UNICEF Toolkit on Accessibility - Section G: Accessibility Checklists
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Audit physical premises and facilities
Tool Name: UNICEF Toolkit on Accessibility - Section G: Accessibility Checklists
Description: Section G of the UNICEF Toolkit on Accessibility provides a series of practical checklists to guide accessibility assessments of programme-related buildings or UNICEF premises. It covers areas like vehicles, parking, pathways, ramps, reception areas, toilets, and more, based on universal design principles.
Common User Queries:
How do I check if my building is accessible?
What are the accessibility requirements for ramps and doorways?
I need a checklist for accessible parking and reception areas

tool_name: Making Schools Accessible to Children with Disabilities
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Assess school infrastructure
Tool Name: Making Schools Accessible to Children with Disabilities
Description: A guidebook by UNICEF providing technical solutions and practical checklists to assess and improve school infrastructure accessibility for children with disabilities. It covers entry/exits, ramps, stairs, corridors, toilets, and more.
Common User Queries:
I want to check if my school is accessible
I need guidelines for accessible toilets and drinking water in schools
What are the standards for school ramps and stairs

user_intent: Train staff on end-to-end event accessibility
tool_name: Disability Inclusion Training - Module 3: Event Accessibility
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Train staff on end-to-end event accessibility
Tool Name: Disability Inclusion Training - Module 3: Event Accessibility
Description: A self-learning module by Mekong Inclusive Ventures and Impact Hub Asia Pacific. It provides comprehensive guidance on planning accessible in-person, virtual, and hybrid events, including checklists, audit items, and visual design standards (fonts, color contrast).
Common User Queries:
How do I check if my event venue is accessible?
What are the best fonts and colors for accessible presentations?
How can I make my virtual meetings more inclusive?

user_intent: Create accessible office documents and multimedia
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Create accessible office documents and multimedia
Tool Name: CBM Digital Accessibility Toolkit
Description: A toolkit by CBM providing practical guidance and tools for creating accessible digital content. It covers document accessibility (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, PDF), multimedia (video, audio), and visual design (fonts, color contrast), based on universal design principles and international standards.
Common User Queries:
How can I check if my digital content is inclusive?
What are the accessibility standards for fonts and colors in digital content?
How do I make my Word and Excel documents accessible?

tool_name: IncludeAbility Guide: Hosting accessible and inclusive online meetings and events
text_to_embed:
User Intent: Host inclusive virtual meetings
Tool Name: IncludeAbility Guide: Hosting accessible and inclusive online meetings and events
Description: A guide by the Australian Human Rights Commission on hosting accessible and inclusive online meetings and events. It covers preparation (platform selection, registration), delivery (captioning, Auslan interpreters, managing audio/visuals), and post-event actions.
Common User Queries:
How do I host an accessible Zoom or Teams meeting?
What are the best practices for online event registration?
How can I support participants with disabilities in online events?
